If you wanna use rbg, use the mainboard header and as many things from one vendor as possibel

I'm just getting one giant headache from thinking about my new computer...
Like, the absurd level of complexity RGB adds is completely unacceptable
You shouldn't have to worry about needing multiple pieces of software to control lighting for everything, and compatibility because each vendor likes using its own proprietary connectors -_-
Eventually I'm gonna reach my eff it point and build a computer with little concern for how everything looks together because screw the system
Again use standard rgb headers
Or stay with one vendor
But yes why the heck is there no standard?
Probably because every single vendors wants to strong-arm you into their ecosystem, because otherwise they'd lose sales
Off the top of my head
MSI Mystic Light, Gigabyte RGB Fusion, ASUS Aura Sync, Corsair iCUE
And while some parts from different vendors are compatible with a given software, there's no real way to unify your entire system under one standard without severely limiting part choices
Example: ASUS's system works well if you have their mobo, gpu, and use G.skill memory
But once you go to CPU coolers and fans, I'm not sure what parts work
:ctwokinds-nibrun::ctwokinds-nibrun:
